Our simulated stable 1 W hydration state was nearly monoclinic, with average UC dimensions of a = 0.511, b = 0.295, and c = 0.705 nm and angles of α = 90.0, β = 104.0, and γ = 89.8°. These results are in line with reported dimensions of Na-birnessite by Newton and Kwon
51 and are within 4% of the values of two previous studies.
60, 61 We also find that K + and water oxygens were positioned in the center interlayer region ( Figure 7 ), in between basal oxygens of the birnessite lattice. This symmetric interlayer structure deviates from previous simulation studies,
39 possibly due to contrasting water contents and forcefield parameters. Still, our results show similar positions of K + and its coordinating water, as was previously shown with MD for Na-birnessite.
